abstract: Police officials say community policing program designed to build relationships between officers and residents is set to expand from 32 to 44 precincts and housing projects, just under half of all commands in New York City; program's pilot in Far Rockaway has so far gotten mixed reviews from residents and community leaders, who either laud program's effectiveness, or admit they were not even aware it was happening.
lead_paragraph: The Police Department and Mayor Bill de Blasio have endorsed putting officers on the streets to mingle with residents, in an effort to reduce crime and ease tensions.
snippet: The Police Department and Mayor Bill de Blasio have endorsed putting officers on the streets to mingle with residents, in an effort to reduce crime and ease tensions....

headline.main: Community Policing Expands in New York, but Some Question if It Works
headline.print_headline: Community Policing Expands, but Some Question Whether It Works
